Homer Simpson
(555) 123-4567 | homer.simpson@springfieldnuclear.com
Summary
• A detail-oriented machine learning scientist with over 7 years of experience in implementing machine learning and deep learning-
 based solutions, including Gen AI models (LLM models and Agentic applications), performing A/B hypotheses, and developing
 predictive models, monitoring, deploying and scaling models, developing model explainability methods and performing MLOps
 and LLMOps.
• Experienced with GenAI technologies, including prompt engg, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), fine-tuning LLMs
 and Vector Dbs.
• Well-versed with ETL techniques & creating large-scale data engineering pipelines in Python, SQL & Spark over the cloud.
• Experienced with Managing teams, mentoring diverse talent, Agile methodologies, and SDLC activities for increased productivity.
Technical Skills
GenAI: Llama, OpenAI, Llama, Mistral, Langchain, CrewAI, LLamaIndex, FastMCP, LangGraph, Vector Dbs, AutoGen, LORA, QLORA.
ML: Python, R, Packages: Numpy, Sklearn, gensim, Pandas, spacy, nltk, Keras, xgboost, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, PyTorch
Data Analytics Tools: Tableau, D3.js, Dataiku, Google Analytics, Excel, PowerBI
Cloud Tools: Azure (ML, OpenAI, DataLake, Synapse, DataFactory, DataBricks), AWS (Lambda, Glue, SageMaker, RDS, Athena,
 BedRock, S3, RedShift, QuickSight, EC2), GCP (BigQuery, VertexAI, Cloud AutoML, GCP AI)
MLOps & Data Engg: SQL, Neo4j, Docker, AirFlow, Git, LangSmith, W&B, Kubernetes, Snowflake, dbt, Java, MLFlow, JS, Spark
Work Experience
AI Engineer | Canadian Tire Feb 2025 – Present
• Developed a personalized agentic shopping assistant for Canadian Tire to enhance the shopping experience using OpenAI SDK,
 FastMCP, Weaviate, LangSmith, and Gemini.
• Designed, Architected, and implemented LLMOps Framework: Utilized LangSmith, Azure Databricks, and MLFlow to create a
 robust framework for managing large language models (LLMs) in production environments.
• Led the development of a Generative AI solution to automatically summarize and extract key insights from diverse SOC reports,
 enabling CTC to reduce auditor hiring costs by 70% using Ragas, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure and OpenAI. Performed LLMOps to
 gather feedback regarding the summaries to refine the GenAI solution using LangSmith and MLFlow.
Machine Learning Engineer | Vector Institute (Contract) Jan 2025 – April 2025
• Implemented LLM Models to generate, evaluate and edit SRED reports, including an RAG pipeline to retrieve relevant information from
 knowledge bases using AWS (EC2, Redis, Lambda function), OpenAI, Ragas, etc, with role-based access control (RBAC) and
 prompt-level logging to maintain traceability and secure sensitive content
• Fine-tuned a Large Language Model (LLM) using PyTorch, Ray, FastAPI, Redis, LangSmith and Docker, incorporating
 human-in-the-loop feedback to iteratively optimize performance and output quality across real-world use cases.
Data Scientist | State Street Nov 2024 – Feb 2025
• Spearheaded engineering-led digital transformation by architecting and migrating legacy Excel-based ETL workflows into scalable,
 production-grade Databricks pipelines—eliminating manual bottlenecks and enabling real-time analytics.
• Led the development of an enterprise-grade internal ChatGPT integrated with a secure knowledge store for contextualized retrieval.
• Developed CI/CD Pipelines: Designed and implemented continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using Azure
 DevOps and Databricks jobs, streamlining the operationalization of the ML/LLM lifecycle
Machine learning Engineer | Huawei (University of Toronto) Jan 2022 – June 2024
• Developed supervised machine learning models to perform vulnerability management, achieving a classification accuracy of 92%.
• Performed extensive literature review on current GenAI models for security tasks to understand their weaknesses & shortcomings.
• Led a team of 3 interns to develop a large-scale Transformer-based (BERT-based) vulnerability classification outperforming the
 state of the art by 30%, resulting in a paper accepted to ASE 2024 and a research grant of 100KCAD.
• Implemented a large-scale experimentation pipeline to benchmark the state-of-the-art LLM models for vulnerability detection (20
 models) (including prompt engineering, using multiple vector db/indexing methods, retrieval augmented generation (RAG) &
 fine-tuning using LORA and QLORA) along with model fairness and evaluation metrics. Deployed using Docker and Kubernetes
• Developed weekly reports & dashboards using Tableau, summarizing the vulnerabilities & impact on the overall security.
• Designed and developed a large-scale network tree visualization to depict repository dependencies to understand the impact of
 vulnerabilities across the ecosystem using Python, Tableau, SQL and d3.js.
• Developed A/B experiments to understand the security priorities of open-source repositories with the aim of ensuring secure
 choices by developers
• Tailored and optimized large language models (LLMs), including GPT, LLAMA, and Mistral, enhancing their performance for
 domain-specific generation using prompt engineering, LLM fine-tuning, adapting (LoRA), and PEFT using langchain, & PyTorch.
• Developed model and CI/CD pipelines (MLOps and LLMOps) to track, log, monitor, manage model versions & automate deployment.
• Built large-scale data pipelines (SQL, Python, AWS) to generate new open-source packages, querying millions of
 repos, users & their interaction data to build a recommendation system.
Data Scientist | Digitate (Tata Research -Cloud SaaS) June 2018 – April 2021
• Part of the core machine learning team for designing machine learning algorithms (including XGBoost, Decision Trees, etc) to predict
and optimize batch operations for the product – ignio WorkLoadManagement (WLM)
• Developed time series forecasting models (including ARIMA, SARIMA) for prediction of Batch network node runtimes, AIOPs
network CPU utilization and memory usage aimed toward predicting SLA misses and outages for AIOPs and BatchOPs networks.
• Developed large-scale A/B experiments (testing of new product & UI features for NBS banking app) leading to a 13% increase in
loan applicants.
• Led the incorporation of GCP services for ETL pipelines, and deployment of ML models ensuring MLOps and CI/CD practices.
• Designed dashboards & Network trees to detect & visualize network fault localization and to assist in root cause analysis
(greater than 10K nodes ) using R, d3.js, SQL and Tableau.
• Designed an outlier detection system to derive substance abuse from records of purchase using (SARIMA, and RNN) with an
accuracy of 80% for Loblaws Pharma (As featured in News).
• Developed a deep-learning solution to identify fraudulent transactions from past transactions and credit data for (NBS UK).
• Won the “On the Spot Award” for creating an NLP-based Q&A System using GPT-2, Named Entity Recognition (NER) to interact
with the insights generated by ignio, increasing product trust and usability by 40%

Relevant Publications and Projects
Heart Disease prediction and clinical trial recommendation system
• Developed a heart attack prediction system (random forest & XGBoost-based methods with an accuracy of 92%).
• Designed a large-scale recommendation system to recommend clinical trials based on patient profiles (for heart attack-predicted
patients) using data from clinicaltrials.gov and CDC. Model deployment on Azure using fastAPI, Docker. ML monitoring using Kubeflow.
NLP classification of Stack Overflow Questions
• Fine-tuned GPT-3 using data mined from multiple sources for the classification of StackOverflow questions for enabling better NLPbased recommendations to users with 83% accuracy.
